main event: On November 9, 1963, a local resident in New Paltz, New York, observed an unidentified flying object described as round or circular in shape, emitting a brilliant white light.
interesting points: The object was stationary for several minutes before moving rapidly to the southwest and disappearing from sight., The object was described as being approximately the size of a large automobile tire., A local sheriff's deputy also observed the object hovering about 150 feet above ground., The deputy reported a brilliant blue-white light, with no sound coming from the object., While no additional witnesses were officially confirmed, the report indicated that several other individuals might have seen it.
sighted object: unidentified flying object emitting a bright white light
witness description: local resident; also observed by a sheriff's deputy
